content: Sporting event delegation [Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore) competed at the [1960 Summer Olympics](/wiki/1960_Summer_Olympics) in [Rome](/wiki/Rome), Italy. Five competitors, all men, took part in three events in three sports. This marked the first and only time Singapore competed at the Olympics as a self-governing colony of the United Kingdom under what would later become the national flag. [Tan Howe Liang](/wiki/Tan_Howe_Liang) won the territory's first ever Olympic medal, its only medal until 2008. ## Medalists ### Silver - [Tan Howe Liang](/wiki/Tan_Howe_Liang) â€“ [weightlifting](/wiki/Weightlifting_at_the_1960_Summer_Olympics), men's lightweight The following Singaporean athletes participated in the games: ## Sailing - [James Cooke](/wiki/James_Cooke_(sailor)) - Durcan Thomas Kevin - [Holiday Edward Gilbert](/wiki/Holiday_Edward_Gilbert) ## Shooting One shooter represented Singapore in 1960. [50 m pistol](/wiki/Shooting_at_the_1960_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_50_metre_pistol) - [Kok Kum Woh](/wiki/Kok_Kum_Woh) ## Weightlifting - [Tan Howe Liang](/wiki/Tan_Howe_Liang) (2nd place) - Official Olympic Reports - International Olympic Committee results database This [1960 Summer Olympics](/wiki/1960_Summer_Olympics)-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This article about sports in Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Singapore at the 1960 Summer Olympics
